section.title: What is &carrot;?
section.para: &carrot; is a research framework for experimenting with automated querying of various data sources (such as search engines), processing search results and their visualization.

Under the term "research", we understand that the architecture of the system is oriented mostly toward flexibility, sometimes at a price of performance. Mechanisms such as data exchange via XML language, distributed, dynamically accessible components, the use of Java as primary language of implementation – they all make the system quite easy to tailor to one's needs.
&carrot; was primarily built with search results clustering in mind, but it can be configured or adjusted to do other kinds of pipelined data processing.
